intro: Hubertia ambavilla, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant features palmate leaves and produces vibrant, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Hubertia ambavilla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
